news_header: An international project estimates that cleaning PFAS in Europe could cost up to EUR 95 billion over the next 20 years, with significant efforts needed in Finland as well.
news_text: The Forever Lobbing Project estimates that cleaning PFAS, or eternal chemicals, could cost Europe up to EUR 95 billion over the next two decades. PFAS, used in various industries and consumer products, break down slowly and pose health risks. In Finland, cleaning costs are projected between EUR 137 million and EUR 1.7 billion. The project highlights the urgency of addressing PFAS contamination and the need for effective remediation strategies, as well as the potential rise in costs if no action is taken.
